com.centurylink.mdw.ant.taskdef

Class XPoke

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      • org.apache.tools.ant.Task
        • com.centurylink.mdw.ant.taskdef.XPoke
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class XPoke
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task
    Ant task for setting a value in an XML file using XPath syntax. Examples: 
      <xpoke file="./build.xml" exp="/build/@id" value="${build.id}">
    Updates the id attribute of the build element with the value of the build.id property. The XPath expression must match only a single node. NOTE: FORMATTING MAY BE LOST WHEN THE NEW FILE IS SAVED. 
      <xpath url="http://somehost/something.xml" exp="/build/@id" value="${build.id}">
    Updates the id attribute of the build element with the value of the build.id property. The XPath expression must match only a single node. The host location of the XML URL must allow HTTP PUTs. NOTE: FORMATTING MAY BE LOST WHEN THE NEW FILE IS UPLOADED.
